== Main Inclusion Report for telepath-qt ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/t/telepathy-qt]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of KDE 4
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=telepathy|no CVE entries]]</nowiki>: ...
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=telepathy|no Secunia history]]</nowiki>: ...
** No binaries running
** Does not use network directly (but talks to telepathy daemon which uses the network)
** Data processing done by telepathy daemon
** No known source code review performed
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** The package always works out of the box without configuration
** The package asks no debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:telepathy-qt|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/t/telepathy-qt.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://tapioca-voip.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/tapioca-voip/trunk/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is calm but due to move to KDE svn soon
** <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=146406&atid=765168|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: Twenty or so open
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
** Upstream includes a test suite for the server and test harness for agents is being worked on
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system (cdbs)
0. ''Dependencies:''
** Qt, cmake, dbus, all in main.
0. ''Background information:''
** Upstream call it telepathy-qt
